spell.name: Anxiety
entries: A humanoid you see within range must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes nervous and weak-willed, losing its ability to persuade, perform, and talk elegantly. The creature makes all Charisma checks with disadvantage for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Asphyxiate

m.text: a choker which the spell consumes

entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. A ring of transparent black rope appears around its neck, tightening and causing it to suffocate.

A creature targeted by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage and begins suffocating. While under this effect, it suffers the following:

items: It has disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks.

It can stay conscious for a number of rounds equal to 4 + its Constitution modifier. At the start of the turn afterwards, its health drops to 0 hit points, cannot regain hit points, and automatically fails all death and Constitution saving throws.

entries: On a success, the target takes half as much damage, and does not suffocate.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target. tht

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 4th.

spell.name: Ataxic Bolts
entries: Three arcane projectiles appear above you, spiralling towards three random hostile targets that you can see within range. Each creature targeted by a bolt takes {@damage 8d4} force damage. For each missile, the DM rolls a {@dice d100} and consults the Sorcerer Wild Magic table. The target hit by the magical projectile will be affected by the effects of the table, and has control over any effects on the table that it can choose. For example, if the effect from the table is to cast magic missile at a 5th level, the target can choose which creatures to hit with the spell. Any rolled number that corresponds to an effect that cannot apply to the affected creature must be rerolled until an effect can apply. For instance, rolling a 99-00 for a creature who is not a sorcerer must be rerolled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you summon an additional projectile for every two levels above 5th.

spell.name: Aura of Heat Protection
entries: Temperature changes to suit your needs in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Wisps of flames and ice flow throughout the aura, resisting the effect of dramatic heat changes. When you cast this spell, choose between a cold aura or a warm aura. A cold aura gives resistance to fire damage, while a warm aura gives resistance to cold damage. Any creature inside the aura has resistance to that damage type. Until the spell ends, you may spend an action on subsequent turns to change the temperature of the aura, switching between either of the two states.

spell.name: Ape Form
entries: Thick, dark hair begins sprouting from all parts of your body for the duration, and your form changes in shape to resemble an ape of the same size. You are still recognizable, though the extra features make you difficult to identify from afar. While in this form, you can use a bonus action every turn to make an unarmed strike with Strength that deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier.

Your jump distance is doubled and you make all Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks that relate to climbing with advantage. You have advantage on checks to escape grapples and grapple other creatures. Additionally, you gain a climbing speed equal to your speed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the unarmed strike damage increases by {@dice 1d4} and the duration increases by 1 hour for every level above 3rd.

spell.name: Arcane Shock
entries: You reach out and touch a creature with magical electricity, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d8} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} for the duration of the spell. On a success, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}. On each of the creature's subsequent turns while {@condition stunned}, it can make another Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Acid Funnel

components.m: a vial of dangerous acid and a glass cone

entries: A swirling cone of acrid liquid sprays out from your fingertips. Each creature in the 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} acid damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

spell.name: Bastion of Light

m.text: a cube of marble worth at least 500 gp

entries: A ring of shining white light rises from the ground around a creature you touch, creating a small floating castle of light that grants the creature three-quarters cover for the duration of the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use your reaction whenever a creature lands a weapon attack against the target to instantly deal {@damage 4d6} radiant damage to the attacker.

Additionally, all melee and ranged weapons made by the creature you touch will deal radiant damage instead for the duration. The creature's weapon damage also deals additional radiant damage equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

spell.name: Beanstalk

components.m: a bean and a small cup of water

entries: You transform a Large plant that you can see within range into a tall immovable beanstalk. The beanstalk stands vertically up to 200 feet tall, and takes the space of a 10-foot square. The stalk is segmented into multiple sections. A vine grows out from the stalk 5 feet above ground level, and more vines grow out of the beanstalk for every 10 feet above the one below it. At maximum height, a beanstalk will thus have a total of 20 vines spread throughout the entirety of its body.

Immediately after casting this spell and as a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns, you can attempt to use the vines to grapple a creature within range. Choose a vine along the beanstalk to lash out at a Large or smaller creature 40 feet from the vine's location that is not already {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}. A creature targeted by a vine must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage, be pulled to the location of the vine, and become {@condition restrained}. At the end of a {@condition restrained} creature's turn, it takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage. A creature can choose to use its action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, freeing itself (and dropping to the ground if it does not have a flying speed) on a success against your spell save DC. Each vine can only grapple one creature at a time. A vine that is already restraining a creature will release its current target if it targets a new one. Alternatively, you can have a vine transfer a creature up and down the beanstalk by having a vine target a creature {@condition grappled} by another one. This bonus action deals no damage to the {@condition restrained} creature.

Huge leaves line the entirety of the beanstalk, and you and any creatures you choose can use the beanstalk to climb up and down the stalk. Walking up and down the stalk uses 3 feet of movement for every one foot you move. Additionally, the ground near the beanstalk is filled with huge roots that jut out of the earth. The ground is difficult terrain out to 10 feet around the base of the beanstalk.

spell.name: Big Iron

components.m: An iron plate

entries: You create the illusion of a sleek silver pistol with 6 bullet chambers within your hand. The pistol is considered a one-handed ranged weapon that is able to hit creatures up to 80 feet away.

As an action on your turn, you are able to fire this weapon at a visible creature you see by making a ranged spell attack. Doing so will use up 1 of the 6 different bullet types that the gun holds. When all of the bullets in the gun are used, the gun as well as all the bullets dissipate into air and the spell ends. Additionally, as a bonus action on your turn, you are also able to fire this weapon at a creature you see in range. However, the ranged attack must be made with disadvantage.

The pistol that fires the bullets is extremely unpredictable and unstable. When you use this gun, roll a {@dice d6}. Reroll the dice if the bullet is already used. The number rolled corresponds to the type of bullet that is fired.

entries.name: 1-Psionic Shell
entries: A short, black bullet with a purple head that leaves a faint purple streak as a trail. A creature that is hit takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.

entries.name: 2-Spectral Round
entries: A short, white exoskeleton of a bullet that leaves a trail of shimmering white mist. When a creature is hit, they take {@damage 3d8} force damage. At the end of its next turn, the exoskeleton explodes. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage.

entries.name: 3-Infernal Pierce
entries: A long, dark red bullet that has a fiery double helix as a trail. When a creature is hit, they take {@damage 4d8} fire damage. Additionally, the bullet pierces through the creature and has the potential to hit any creature behind it while still in range. This other creature takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage.

entries.name: 4-Jumping Jolt
entries: A stubby, dark blue bullet with a shiny blue head that emits sparks. When a creature is hit, it takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage. Additionally, the bullet bounces off and travels in the direction of the closest creature within 20 feet of the original target. This new creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On failed save, it is struck by the bullet and takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage.

entries.name: 5-Celestial Ram
entries: A wide, golden bullet that emits light in a 5 foot radius and leaves a fairly opaque golden streak behind it. A creature that is hit takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage. The creature also begins to emit dim light in a 5 foot radius until the spell ends. Additionally, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes partly crippled and its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.

entries.name: 6-Death's Cry
entries: A long, vanta black bullet with a glowing green head. Black sparks spiral around the bullet and it leaves a trail of black lightning bolts. When the bullet travels through the air, it emits an audible demonic roar. When a creature is hit, it takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of you and takes {@damage 1d8} poison damage at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the condition on a success.

spell.name: Bigby's Toad

components.m: A figurine of a glass toad

entries: You conjure a Huge toad of shimmering, translucent force in an unoccupied space within range. The toad lasts for the spell's duration, and it moves and behaves under your command.

The toad is a creature that has AC 14 and hit points equal to twice your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a Strength of 20 (+5) and a Dexterity of 18 (+4). It is immune to all magical effects, and any effects that would force it to make a Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw. The toad, though see-through, is a solid creature, and takes up its entire space.

When you cast this spell and on subsequent turns, you can use a bonus action to command the toad to move up to 40 feet, with a vertical jump distance of 20 feet, and make an attack from the following choices. All of the toad's attacks use your in game statistics.

entries.name: Bite
entries: The toad lunges forward to bite a creature within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} force damage. A creature that is Large or smaller must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or becomes {@condition grappled} in the toad's mouth.

entries.name: Tongue
entries: The toad lashes out to a creature within 15 feet of it with its silvery tongue. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} force damage and is {@condition grappled}. A creature that is Large or smaller must succeed on a Strength saving throw or becomes {@condition grappled} in the toad's mouth.

entries.name: Toe Pads
entries: The toad attempts to deliver a brutal punch of force with its silvery toe pads curled up in a tight fist. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} force damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Swallow
entries: Make a melee spell attack on a creature that is {@condition grappled} in the toad's mouth. On a hit, the creature becomes swallowed into the toad's stomach, where it becomes virtually trapped.

A swallowed creature is protected from outside harm as it is surrounded by the translucent flesh of the giant toad. A swallowed creature is {@condition restrained} and has total cover from attacks and other effects from outside the toad. If the toad takes 30 or more damage in a single turn from a creature inside of it, you must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to half that damage or the toad regurgitates the creature it swallowed in a space within 5 feet of it.

Bigby's toad can have four Medium or smaller creatures swallowed at the same time, or one Large creature. Only one creature can be {@condition grappled} at any given time inside of the toad's mouth. The stomach of the toad is the only part of it that is not in a translucent form. Instead, there is an opaque dripping pool of silvery slime inside of the toad's stomach. At the end of a swallowed creature's turn, it takes {@damage 8d8} acid damage as the silvery liquid boils its flesh.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage of every attack and the damage of the stomach acid increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 7th.

spell.name: Binding Curse

m.text: a chain at least 20 feet long and a crystal skull worth at least 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You place a curse on a piece of armor, a weapon, or a magic item that prevents the bearer from removing it. Upon casting the spell, you imprint in the item a black sigil, marking the item with the curse. A creature that dons a cursed piece of armor cannot remove it until the curse is dispelled. A creature that wields a cursed weapon can not stray 3 feet or more away from the item or take {@damage 5d10} necrotic damage a round. Pulling a cursed item away from the creature it is bound to reveal a thin black tether to the sigil, and the resistance will increase the farther you try to pull it away.

When casting this spell, you have the option of making the bearer of the item resistant to necrotic damage in return for a vulnerability to radiant damage. Additionally, you can choose one ability score. The creature wielding the item will have disadvantage on all ability checks and saving throws with that ability.

You can increase the difficulty of removing the curse by casting this spell at a level higher than 4th, expending that spell slot instead. A creature can attempt to remove the curse by casting either dispel magic or remove curse. Either spell will guarantee to succeed on removing the curse if it is casted at a spell level higher or equal to the level at which you cast this spell. Otherwise, the creature attempting to remove the curse must make an ability check with their spellcasting modifier against a DC equal to 10 + the level at which this spell is casted. On a success, the binding curse is removed.

A creature who has not noticed signs of the magical curse can attempt to make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC to notice the black sigil inscribed in the item. On a success, the creature notices it, but will only know the nature of the curse from a successful Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check.

spell.name: Blizzard

components.m: a snowball and a shard of ice

entries: You create a cataclysmic storm of hail, ice, and snow in a 60-foot sphere centered on you. The sphere moves with you, centered on you.

Any creature other than you that starts its turn in the area of the spell must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} cold damage on a failed save. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature that fails the Constitution saving throw by 5 or more suffers from an internal frostbite, taking 5 cold damage at the beginning of each of its turns. This effect is removed once the spell ends, when the creature takes fire damage, or is warmed up by any magical means. The area of the blizzard is lightly obscured, and is considered difficult terrain to all creatures other than you.

As a bonus action on each of your turns until the spell ends, you can send down a storm of sharp icicles or heavy hail on all the creature's within the area. Every creature in the blizzard must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} piercing damage if you choose icicles or {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage if you choose hail. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the cold and object damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 7th.

spell.name: Bubble
entries: You conjure a bubble of heavy water at a point you see within range. The bubble is a 5-foot diameter sphere and its space is considered difficult terrain. As a bonus action on every subsequent turn until the spell ends, you can move the bubble up to 20 feet in any direction.

When the spell ends, the bubble pops, bursting water out to every creature within 20 feet of it. Every creature caught within the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save becomes soaked with the slimy water, and has its movement speed halved until the end of its next turn. The ground within the area of effect becomes difficult terrain for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 3rd.

spell.name: Bypass
entries: For the duration of the spell, all your attacks and spells' damage type becomes force, overcoming many creature's resistances and immunities.

spell.name: Can of Worms

components.m: a can filled with earthworms

entries: Long black worms crawl out of the earth in a 20-foot-radius circle centered on a point that you can see within range. The worms remain for the duration, giving off a pungent odor. The area is considered difficult terrain.

When you cast this spell, each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The worms leech off of the target's blood, transferring its life force over to yours. You heal for an amount equal to half the necrotic damage every time the worms bite a creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Cards of Fate

m.text: a deck of playing cards worth at least 50 gp

entries: Three translucent throwing cards appear in your hand. You choose three creatures that you can see within range to throw the cards at. Make a ranged spell attack for each target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} piercing damage and is marked by the cards of fate for the duration of the spell. You can choose to not deal the damage to a creature.

On every subsequent turn while the spell is active, you can use a bonus action to have one of the following effects apply to one of the creatures marked by your spell. You cannot choose the same effect to occur on consecutive rounds.

entries.name: Hearts
entries: Red hearts appear in a circle around the creature. The target heals for an amount of hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier.

entries.name: Diamonds
entries: A mote of pain streaks through the creature's mind. The targeted creature takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage.

entries.name: Clubs
entries: Each muscle in the creature's body begins freezing up. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Spades
entries: The targeted creature instantly takes {@damage 5d8} slashing damage as cards spring out of the target's body, slashing it with paper cuts as it falls to the ground. The creature is no longer marked.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@damage 1d8} damage for each spell slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Cerebral Tear
entries: Your eyes gleam a deadly shade of red as you attempt to rip the mind apart. Choose a creature you see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 18d6} psychic damage on a failed save. A creature that failed the save also has its Intelligence score reduced by {@dice 1d6}, and can only be restored automatically after 7 days or with a spell like greater restoration, heal, or wish. The spell has no effect on undeads, constructs, or any creature that does not have a brain.

The sheer mental force of this spell causes the target's brain to begin physically tearing. If the damage dealt by this spell reduces the target's hit point to 0, or if the ability score reduction drops its Intelligence to 0, the creature does not fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, its brain rips to pieces and the body tears in half, causing it to instantly die. The body can only be brought back with a wish or true resurrection spell if killed this way. A regenerate spell would mend the body, allowing for other methods of revivification.

spell.name: Circle of Toughness
entries: Spectral shields float around in a sphere out within 30 feet of you, protecting you and your allies from harm. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you. All damage to creatures you choose when you cast this spell that are inside the circle is reduced by 2. Additionally, no single attack or spell can do more than 35 damage to these creatures while inside the circle. When they would take more than that amount in one hit, they instead take 35 damage, and the remaining amount is redirected to the circle of toughness. The circle has an amount of hit points equal to five times your paladin level. Once the circle is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

spell.name: Circlet of Healing

m.text: a crown and a ruby worth at least 500 gp

entries: You create a phantom crown of rubies floating above your head, consisting of six small red gems that generate  dim light out to 20 feet. As part of the action you used to conjure the crown and as a bonus action on each subsequent turn until the spell ends, you can send a gem out in the direction of a creature you see within 60 feet of you. A creature hit by the gem regains {@dice 3d8 + 3} hit points and is cured of a single effect causing it to be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition paralyzed}.

The spell ends when you have used up all six of the gems in the crown. When the spell ends, a burst of healing energy is released from the crown, healing every creature of your choice within 20 feet of you for {@dice 3d8} hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the hit points regained for both the initial and final heal is increased by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 7th.

spell.name: Cloak of Spines

components.m: a thorn

entries: A willing target's skin and clothing begins to grow sharp magical spines capable of piercing even the toughest of armor. Any creature that makes an unarmed strike against the affected target will take {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. Additionally, if the target is {@condition grappled} by another creature, or is grappling another creature, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage at the start of each of their turns as long as the grapple is taking place.

spell.name: Clockwork Drift

m.text: a visibly healthy leaf and a visibly old and brittle leaf, both of which the spell consumes

entries: An area in a 20-foot radius on a point centered within range begins to show signs of rapid aging. For instance, for creatures who are witnessing the illusion, any creature that is found within the area the illusion is affecting will appear to rapidly mature and potentially succumb to old age. Plants that are found within the area of the illusion will appear to grow and eventually rot away as they age. Metals found in the illusion will appear to rust and corrode, and structures can have the chance of collapsing as a result of its weakened structural integrity. The illusion proceeds at a rate of 2 years of aging for every minute passed.

If a creature uses its action to examine the illusion, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

spell.name: Combustion
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, you send a magical blue flame through your arms into the creature's body. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to snap your fingers and ignite the flame from inside of the target, ending the spell. The fire damage dealt is equal to an amount of d4s equal to how many rounds the flame stayed inside of the creature + your spellcasting modifier. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking half damage on a successful save and the full damage on a failed one. The flame does not ignite if the spell ends in a different way.
A creature targeted by this spell can choose to use its bonus action to make a Constitution check. On a success, the flame dissipates and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 5th-level spell slot, the damage dice is a {@dice d8}. When you cast this spell using an 8th-level spell slot, the damage dice is a {@dice d12}.

spell.name: Conjure Duplicates
entries: You project five identical duplicates of yourself, each appearing out of thin air at a point you choose within range. Simultaneously, you can choose to teleport to a point you see within range.

A duplicate has 15 health, but otherwise shares the same exact ability scores, AC, and movement speed as you. On your turn, you can direct each individual duplicate to move to whichever space you want, and they all will take the exact same action as you. Any spell or weapon attack made by your duplicates deals no damage and has no additional effects. A duplicate can only cast cantrips or make weapon attacks, so if you attempt to cast a higher leveled spell, use a bonus reaction, or use a reaction, your duplicates will stand motionless while you perform those things.

When you talk, every duplicate's mouth will move and say the same things that you did. A detect magic spell allows the caster to identify whether a creature is a duplicate because it is considered magical. A duplicate will disappear when the spell ends or when its hit points are reduced to 0.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you conjure one additional duplicate for every level above 5th.

spell.name: Corrosive Touch
entries: Your hand becomes a vessel of disease and corrosion, melting and rusting flesh with just a touch. Make a melee spell attack against a creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} acid damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is inflicted with a rust infection. For the duration of the spell, every time the infected creature attempts to perform an action, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 or a 2, the creature's body locks up, and the action fails to happen that round.
You can alternatively use this spell to create a penalty on a melee weapon made out of metal. The acid and rust takes its place in the weapon, causing it to take a permanent -1 to damage rolls.

spell.name: Create Tracker

components.m: a copy of the item you are trying to create

entries: You create an item of any design no larger than 5 feet in any dimension at a point within range. The object must be a solid, worth less than 100 gp, and if you are attempting to make a duplicate of another item, your creation will have none of the original item's magical properties if it has any. A normal creature sees the tracker you created as a regular object, but sees a magical outline around the object if it has {@sense truesight} or can see invisibility.

Until the spell ends, you can use an action to switch between your vision and the vision from the tracker. Through the tracker, you can see and hear as if you were in its space. Any perception abilities like {@sense darkvision} or {@sense tremorsense|MM} can carry through to what you see and hear through the tracker. While looking through the tracker, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own senses.

The spell ends if the tracker is destroyed or dispelled by magic, turning the tracker into a pile of fine gray dust. It can also end if the object is moved farther than 10 miles away from where it was originally casted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is 7 days. When you cast this spell using a 8th-level spell slot, the duration is 30 days. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, the spell lasts until either it is dispelled or if you create a new tracker.

spell.name: Crimson Toxin

components.m: a bottle of carrion crawler poison

entries: You conjure a cloud of reddish fog around a creature you see within range. If the target is breathing as this spell is casted, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw as the intoxicating cloud attempts to make its way into its body. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d12} poison damage and is unable to take any bonus actions or reactions until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and can still perform its turn like normal.

spell.name: Cryo Beam
entries: A single sphere of ice expands to release a huge beam of snow and frost in a 60-foot long line. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} cold damage and {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Any ground caught in the area of effect of this spell turns to difficult terrain covered in snow for a minute. A creature that fails its saving throw also has its speed halved until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the cold damage increases by {@damage 1d8} damage for each spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Cyclopean Cog

components.m: an iron cog

entries: You call forth a colossal upright iron cog from an otherworldly rift directly in front of you to trample your enemies. This cog is 10 feet wide and is 40 feet in diameter. Creatures that are targeted by this rolling cog must roll a {@dice d20} if they are Medium sized or smaller on the floor. On a roll of 10 or less, the creature takes {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage as it is crushed by the cog's massive teeth. A roll of 11 or higher results in the creature avoiding the cog as it is caught in the space between the gear teeth. A creature that is Large or larger or one that is flying less than 40 feet above the ground must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage. This cog deals double damage to objects and structures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 5th.

spell.name: Dazzling Arc

components.m: fire and a golden chain

entries: A bolt of white radiant fire darts out of your fingertips, sending sparks of light at a creature you see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 7d10} radiant damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

On a failed save, the light arc takes hold of the creature, using it as a focus to continue its path. The light leaps off to another creature you choose within 15 feet of the original target. The arc continues to jump to another target you see within the same distance, and will continue to repeat the jumps until it makes six leaps or there is no longer a target close enough to continue the arc. As such, up to seven creatures can be targeted by this spell in total. The bolt can not travel back to a creature that is already targeted by this spell.

The damage decreases by {@dice 1d10} off the original damage for each creature hit after the first. Therefore, a seventh creature hit by the spell will take {@damage 1d10} radiant damage before the arc fizzes off into the light. Any creature targeted by this spell can make a Dexterity saving throw, taking the new amount of damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

The arc crackles with radiant energy, delivering a distracting burst of bright light as it makes contact with a creature. Any target that fails its saving throw can not take reactions until the end of your next turn, as the light puts the creature's mind into a mildly dazed state.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the range at which the bolt can jump between creatures increases by 5 feet for every level above 6th.

spell.name: Death Smog
entries: You conjure a deadly cloud of dark green fog shrouded in darkness in a 40-foot radius sphere, centered at a point within range. For the duration of the spell, the radius of the smog increases by 10 feet at the start of each of your turns. The area inside the smog is magical darkness and the radius extends up to a maximum of 140 feet. The smog travels through walls and continues expanding to fill its maximum space.

A creature that starts its turn inside of the death smog and is breathing must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 12d12} poison damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. Additionally, a creature that is not immune to poison that fails the saving throw begins to turn into stone and is {@condition restrained}. A creature partly turned to stone has to make an additional Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. After three successes, the effect ends on the target, while after three failures, the target is {@condition petrified} until freed by a greater restoration, heal, or wish spell. The successes and failures do not have to be consecutive; keep track of both until a creature collects three of a kind.

A creature can use its reaction every turn to hold its breath and take {@damage 4d12} poison damage instead, with half as much on a successful save. The death smog is thicker than most air pollutants, and it seeps into even the pores of the creature's skin, making holding its breath much more difficult of a task than otherwise. A creature can hold its breath for an amount of turns equal to 3 + the creature's Constitution modifier (minimum of 3 turns) before it drops to 0 hit points and is dying.

Once the spell ends, the smog does not disappear. Instead, it weakens and becomes less thick. The area becomes lightly obscured, the damage as a result of not holding one's breath decreases to {@dice 3d12}, and creatures holding its breath no longer take damage. A creature intoxicated by the death smog has a slight tint of green in their skin color with their nerves clearly visible until the smog is completely gone. The smog can be dispersed by either a strong gust of wind blowing through it for 1 hour or after 24 hours naturally.

spell.name: Debilitate
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack before this spell ends, you magically force the target to show signs of its frailty. This attack deals an additional {@damage 2d4} psychic damage and forces the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you learn which of the creature's ability scores is the lowest, and until the spell ends, the creature has disadvantage on all checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Detect Life
entries: For the duration, you know the amount and location of all visible living creatures within 30 feet of you. Any creature you have seen before and recognize faintly shimmer with a white light that only you can see, even through walls, and you know exactly what creature it is.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Dig

components.m: a rock and a claw

entries: You touch one willing creature. The target gains a burrow speed of 15 feet for the duration. Additionally, the target gains 15 feet of Tremorsense.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for every two levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Dimensional Rupture

m.text: a chain link, a white rock, and a black gemstone worth 500 gp

entries: One creature within range must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, they will be mentally transported into the depths of a starry void where no one can help it. Here, the creature is tied with chains and is floating freely within this dark space, where it is unable to move in any direction. Simultaneously, a colossal vertical fissure opens 1000 feet in front of the creature, expelling blue flames outwards at high velocities. This fissure continues to expand to a point at which a giant whitish-gray rocky mass begins to appear travelling swiftly in the creature's direction. When this mass collides with the creature, it will be mentally transported back into its current plane, take {@damage 16d6} psychic damage, be knocked back up to 100 feet away from its position, and become {@condition prone}. For every 10 feet it is knocked back, it will take an additional {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. Any creature who this creature is knocked into must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take the same amount of bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

To escape the incoming planetoid, the creature must succeed on three saving throws against your spell save DC in the given order: a Strength saving throw, a Wisdom saving throw, and an Intelligence saving throw. Only one saving throw can be made at the end of the creature's turns. These saves must be made successfully within 5 turns of the spell being successfully casted upon the creature. Successes in these saving throws are depicted in the following table.
Strength. Allows the creature to break free of the chains binding them and brace for impact; reduces bludgeoning damage by half and is not knocked {@condition prone}.
Wisdom. Allows the creature to mentally prepare for the incoming planetoid; reduces psychic damage taken by {@dice 6d6}.
Intelligence. Allows the creature to completely escape the illusion and regain control of its body in its current plane; does not take any damage because the planetoid never collides.

While the creature is under the effects of the illusion, its physical body is {@condition grappled} and left {@condition incapacitated} by the magical chains bounding it.  A creature may attack and damage the bounded creature, and by doing so will result in an opportunity for the creature under the illusion to make an immediate reroll of the current saving throw they are on. Once the spell ends, these chains dissipate and the creature is mentally brought out of the starry void.

spell.name: Draining Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, you drain its life force, dealing an additional {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage. You utilize this gathered life force to mend your own wounds, healing an amount equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the necrotic damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dynamite

components.m: iron powder and charcoal

entries: You throw a bright brass sphere set alight by magical blue flames at a point within range. The sphere spews flames out violently as it lands, but remains still on the ground for the duration. At the start of every subsequent turn of yours, roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the brass ball expands into a massive explosion of blue fire. Any creature within 40 feet of the brass sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} fire damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Any creature within 300 feet of the center of the explosion hears it. If the dynamite has not yet exploded by the time the spell has reached its full duration, the dynamite instantly explodes.
A creature that attempts to pick up the dynamite or starts its turn with the item in hand must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the dynamite instantly explodes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for every level above 5th.

spell.name: Eldritch Hellfire
entries: You call upon ancient wellsprings of eldritch magic to create chaos. Three beams of crackling energy form from the ground in a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder centered on points you can see within range.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time or starts its turn there, it becomes subject to the dangerous energy emitting from the beams and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d10} force damage.  On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.  A creature may only be subjected to the effects of one beam at a time, regardless if multiple beams occupy the space of a creature.
Additionally, you have some degree of control over these beams. As an action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you may do one of the following:

entries.name: Traverse
entries: You can move one of the beams up to 40 feet in a direction of your choice you can see within range.

entries.name: Abyssal Shock
entries: Greenish-blue spectral bolts of energy rise from otherworldly cracks on the floor in a 20-foot radius circle centered from one beam you choose. Three Large or smaller creatures you choose in this area are zapped by these bolts and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Warp
entries: You channel the beams' energy to teleport a creature of your choice. A creature caught inside of a beam must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or is teleported to the center of another existing beam. The creature cannot be teleported into hazards such as a pit or fire.

entries.name: Hellfire
entries: Flaming greenish-blue meteors fall in a 20 foot radius around the center of an existing beam. All creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pelted by meteors and takes {@damage 4d10} force damage.

spell.name: Eldritch Wall
entries: A translucent wall of bright crackling energy appears at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or rest on a solid surface. The wall can be made up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d10} force damage, and half as much on a success.

A creature that ends its turn in or attempts to move through the wall takes {@damage 4d10} force damage. Additionally, a creature must make a Charisma saving throw when entering the area of the wall. On a failed save, the creature becomes victim to a force of repelling energy the wall sends towards it. The creature is launched 15 feet away from the wall in a random direction and is knocked {@condition prone}.

You can also command the wall to expel a punishing blast of repelling energy at your foes. As a bonus action, you are able to create a 15-foot cone of energy centered from a point in the area of the wall. Any creature within the cone must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. Additionally, the height of the wall decreases by 5 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for every level above 5th.

spell.name: Elemental Shield
entries: Choose one of the following types of damage: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You conjure a shield around yourself that absorbs the chosen damage type. The shield is transparent upon casting, is only visible to you, and has 50 hit points.

Whenever you take damage of the type you chose above, the damage is redirected to the shield instead. If a spell or weapon attack contains two separate damage types, only the one that you chose will go to the shield. When the shield is damaged for the first time, it becomes translucent to all creatures, appearing as a sheen bubble colored based on the damage type.  The spell ends once it drops to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the wall gains 10 hitpoints for every level above 4th.

spell.name: Elemental Spice

components.m: a spice of your choice

entries: You touch a pile of spice no heavier than 1 pound, imbuing it with an elemental flavor of your choice. A creature that ingests the spice takes damage over the course of the spell's duration. When you cast the spell, you choose either acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder as the spell's damage type.

Every 10 minutes since the creature ingests the spice, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} damage of the element that you imbued the spice with. Spice affected by this spell is not physically discernable from the same type of spice without the use of magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spice does an extra {@damage 1d6} damage every 10 minutes for every two levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Erratic Melody

components.m: an instrument that has been tuned poorly

entries: You play a ghastly melody with your poorly tuned instrument, which wreaks havoc upon the ears of those who listen to it. Every creature within 30 feet of you, including you, must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} psychic damage on a failed save. Any creature who is {@condition deafened} or has their hearing ability impaired in any form will not be affected by the melody.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, your melody becomes increasingly dreadful and the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Field of Mist

components.m: a glass globe filled with smoke

entries: Fog begins to creep out of the ground in a circle around you. The fog creeps high enough to heavily obscure any Tiny or crawling creatures inside the area. The ground is not visible, and the entire area is lightly obscured due to the mist that extends out of the fog. When you cast this spell, you can select an amount of creatures to be affected by this spell equal to your spellcasting modifier. An affected creature's form becomes slightly misty, wavering in the air.

As a bonus action, a creature who is affected by the mist can teleport to a point within the area of the spell, being consumed by the mist and reforming at the new location. A strong wind can disperse the mist and end the spell after 6 rounds.

spell.name: Fire Curse
entries: You mutter a word of devilish nature, attempting to curse an enemy with a flaming bind on their soul. A creature targeted by this spell must make a Charisma saving throw or be cursed for the duration of the spell. Whenever the cursed creature takes damage, it takes an additional {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Flash
entries: You attempt to temporarily erase the vision of every creature within 20 feet of a point you choose within range. White spark crackles out of a target's eyes, and the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's eyes roll backwards to show only empty white eyes, thus being {@condition blinded}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the blinding effect on a success. Regardless of whether a creature is {@condition blinded} or not, a creature that failed its initial saving throw has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks relating to sight until the spell ends.

spell.name: Fragility

components.m: a brittle bone and a turquoise skull

entries: You utter a curse, sending a column of turquoise smoke down on a creature of your choice within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses the ability to resist danger properly, and automatically fails any saving throw made to reduce damage of a weapon or spell attack to half. Additionally, every weapon and spell attack is a critical hit if it hits.

spell.name: Ghost Sight

m.text: crushed beetroot, a silk cloth, and the eye of a humanoid that has been turned into a ghost which the spell consumes

entries: The spell allows you to gain the vision of a ghost, being able to hear and see through any object out to 30 feet. You also get {@sense darkvision} up to this distance if you do not already have it. Your ghostly vision detaches from your body, which remains motionless where you cast the spell, {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own senses. You are able to move around as a translucent floating head, and are not able to go through walls. A thin spectral tether connects between your physical self and your floating head, and moving farther away than 30 feet from your body will cause the tether to snap, ending the spell and dealing {@damage 5d10} psychic damage to you. Taking damage while in your ghostly form will mentally alert you that something is damaging your body. When the spell ends, you return back to your physical body.

spell.name: Giant Weapon
entries: You enhance a weapon you touch with magical energy. Until the spell ends, every single time a creature makes a melee attack with the weapon, a much larger spectral version of the weapon appears around it, following its exact movement. This enhancement increases a creature's reach by 10 feet as long as it is using this weapon. Additionally, its melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage on a hit. If the weapon isn't already a magic weapon, it becomes one for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} and its reach increases by 5 additional feet for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Globe of Glass

m.text: a small glass sphere worth at least 100 gp

entries: A shimmering sphere resembling a glass dome appears centered at a point on the ground within range. The sphere has a 20-foot radius, and any creature in the space of the glass sphere's edge is forced to an empty space of your choice on either side. The sphere is translucent, impassable by non magical movement, and any creature that pushes on the sphere feels a resistance of force. Ranged weapon and spell attacks can still pass through the globe, as can melee attacks that have a reach of at least 10 feet.

As an action on every subsequent turn, you can move the sphere up to 20 feet to another point with solid ground by a path that is unobstructed. Moving the globe of glass through an area where there is an object that is not originally in the sphere in the way will immediately end the spell. Creatures within the area of the spell are moved along with the glass dome to stay inside it.

The globe is a semi-physical object that can be damaged and broken. It has an AC equal to your spell save DC and health equal to twice your hit point maximum. If the globe's health is reduced to 0, the spell ends as the sphere shatters into shards of force, and any creature within 10 feet of the dome must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} force damage.

spell.name: Heartburn
entries: You choose up to three creatures within range to place this curse of continual pain upon. A target of this spell must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature that failed the saving throw takes an immediate 2 fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends. This curse can be removed with any healing magic or spell with similar effects to lesser restoration. The spell ends on any creature that is reduced to 0 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can choose to target one additional creature for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Illusory Impasse

components.m: a block of ashwood, a stone, and wet soil

entries: You create illusory holes in the ground to resemble a dark chasm or ravine. The general shape of the terrain is the same, including the gains and drops in elevation from hills and mountains. The area in which you create the illusion is made up of up to thirty 15-foot cubes connected adjacently to one another, with all cubes being within range. The ground where the illusion is cast is seen as a ravine to all other creatures. You and any creatures you choose upon casting this spell instead see the ravine as a glimmering translucent image, and can properly see the ground that it is covering. The ravine's depth, composition, and shape is up to your choosing. The inside of the impasse can be whatever you want, possibly ranging from a bubbling pit of lava to a base camp of goblins.

As long as you see the illusion, you can control anything inside the ravine to move however you choose as precisely as possible. You are able to project sounds from any point in the area of the illusion you see. You can have two goblins converse with each other inside of the trench, or you can have an illusory dragon roar loudly. Any sound that you generate can only be heard 500 feet away from the location you casted the spell. A creature that hears any vocal illusion or sees any movement you created can make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC, recognizing there to be an illusion on a success.

If you don't generate any movement or sound from the illusion, any creature that has not physically touched the illusion, did not see you cast the spell, or failed its check to recognize the illusion believes the ravine to be real and is magically compelled to not walk over the area or into the ravine. A creature can still fly across, but a strong creature that normally can jump such a ravine with ease will be compelled not to do so.

If you pass through the area or interact with the illusion in a way that makes it seem unreal, any creature that sees you can make the Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check, seeing through the illusion on a success. A creature that discerns the illusory impasse for what it is, sees the original terrain, and any vocal or visual creations from the spell become faint to the creature.

spell.name: Immutable
entries: For the duration, a willing creature you touch cannot be affected by any transmutation spell. A creature that is unwilling can make a Charisma saving throw, ending the spell on a success. A creature that fails this save will immediately revert the creature to its original state and prevent the creature from being affected by transmutation spells.

spell.name: Infectious Bean
entries: You conjure a small lime obloid bean in your hand and hurl it at a creature you see within range. A target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If the target is standing on any plants, small weeds grow out of the ground, making the 15 feet by 15 square centered where the bean lands difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Infernal Chasm

m.text: a forked metal rod, worth at least 1000 gp, attuned to either the Abyss or the Nine Hells

entries: The ground is ripped apart to form a massive ravine centered on a point within range. This chasm can take the form of a 100 feet long fissure, or a ring with an inner diameter of up to 40 feet. Either way, the chasm is 20 feet wide and extends 200 feet deep. At the bottom of the chasm lies an extradimensional portal to either the Abyss or the Nine Hells (depending on the rod you used). Flames occasionally billow out in bursts of intense heat, and an ominous infernal laughter that fills the entire chasm can be heard up to 100 feet away. When you cast this spell, all creatures within the area where the chasm opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or begin falling into the chasm. A creature that succeeds on the save will move to the closest edge.
Every subsequent turn while the spell is active, you can use an action to cause one of the following effects of your choice to happen. You cannot use the same effect on consecutive rounds.

entries.name: Quake
entries: The ground surrounding the edges of the chasm momentarily bursts upward and shakes violently. Any creature within 20 feet of the edge of the chasm must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pushed 15 feet towards the edge. A creature that arrives at the edge and is still moving forward falls into the ravine. Additionally, on a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage, and half as much on a successful one as rocks splinter violently out of the ground.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Three ghastly spectral claws resembling a fiery worm shoot out of the ravine. Choose a target within 20 feet of an edge of the chasm for each claw, and that target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 14d8} fire damage on a failed save. A creature who fails the save is also infected with a mild infernal disease. A lingering flame within the creature causes them to take an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage every single time it takes damage. Using lesser restoration or similar magic, or dousing the creature's body in water will remove this effect. A successful save deals only half as much damage and the creature does not get infected.

entries.name: Summon
entries: You call out into the chasm to request for its infernal assistance. You pick either {@dice 3d4} spined devils, {@dice 1d6} bearded devils, or {@dice 1d2} barbed devils for the Nine Hells, and you can pick {@dice 1d3} shadow demons, {@dice 1d2} barlguras, or 1 chasme for the Abyss. You can pick where the fiends you rolled are summoned as long as they are summoned within 20 feet of the edge of the ravine or are in the ravine. The fiends are not allies to you, can be hostile, and are controlled by the DM. A summoned fiend will act as they would normally, and they will disappear after 24 hours.

entries.name: Howl
entries: The ghastly breathing from inside the ravine increases in volume momentarily, giving off a deathly moan. Any creature you choose that is not {@condition deafened} and is not a fiend within 60 feet of ravine or is in the ravine must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 20 psychic damage and is {@condition stunned}. A successful save deals 10 psychic damage, and the creature does not get {@condition stunned}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on a success.

The area within 30 feet of the chasm is filled with small cracks and stones, making it difficult terrain. The extradimensional portal at the bottom of the chasm emits bright light out to 100 feet, and dim light to 100 feet beyond that.

A creature that falls into the extradimensional portal exits their plane of existence and appears at a random location on the plane of existence represented by the tuning fork. If the spell ends before the full duration is over, the creature will be teleported back to the original plane it was on at the point it last felt the surface ground. If the spell ends as a result of reaching the full duration, any creature that fell into the portal will be trapped on the new plane of existence and must find their way back by their own means.

spell.name: Insight
entries: You look deep into the mind of another creature, and quickly learn about its strengths and its weaknesses. A creature you see within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the exact value of two of the creature's different ability scores of your choosing. If the challenge rating of the creature you attempt to identify is 11 or higher, the DM may choose to give you a rough estimate instead of a precise value.
If you are casting this spell as a ritual, the creature you are reading must be in your sight for the entire casting time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 5th-level spell slot, the challenge rating limit is 16. When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, the challenge rating limit is 21. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you will always get the exact scores.

spell.name: Intoxicating Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, you imbue a magical poison into the bodies of your enemies, dealing an additional {@damage 4d8} poison damage. Additionally, the poison blurs the way the target thinks and hinders its bodily performance. The creature has to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or loses proficiency in all of its saving throws until the spell ends.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition poisoned} in this way.

spell.name: Invoke Weakness

components.m: a dead firefly and a sharp stone

entries: You roughly locate the areas of weakness on a creature you choose within range by invoking faint glows in the target's body. Once per turn, any creature attempting to make a melee attack against your target creature must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check contested by the target's Intelligence check.
On a success, the creature knows the location of all of the target's brittle points. Each melee attack made by a creature that notices these glows deals an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature within range for every level above 1st.

spell.name: Iron Mind

m.text: iron dust worth at least 100 gp

entries: You strengthen the mind of a willing creature you touch, protecting it from debilitating mental effects. The target of this spell gains a mental barrier that has 50 hit points for the duration of the spell. Whenever the creature takes psychic damage, the damage is redirected towards the barrier. If an effect or attack brings the barrier's hit points to 0, the spell ends, and any excess damage carries over to the creature.

Additionally, the creature gets advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against divination, enchantment, and illusion spell effects. The target can retaliate mentally against any creature that attempts to infiltrate its mind. The caster attempting to do so must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} psychic damage on a failed save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the hit points of the mental barrier increases by 25 for every level above 6th.

spell.name: Ivan's Invisible Realm

m.text: a white marble worth at least 500 gp

entries: You create a 40-foot radius field of wind and smoke centered at a point within range. The area is lightly obscured. When you cast this spell, you choose an amount of creatures to benefit from this spell equal to 2 + your spellcasting modifier. An affected creature turns translucent but still visible, shimmering with a white outline across its body. At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can roll a {@dice d20}. On a 11 or higher, the creature turns {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn.

The swift winds that blow through the region of the spell allow for an affected creature to travel throughout the area at a rapid pace and without making much sound. Affected creatures can take the {@action Hide} action even when lightly obscured. Additionally, any target in the area of effect of this spell gets advantage on {@skill Stealth} (Dexterity) checks, a hover speed equal to its speed, and the ability to use a bonus action to take the {@action Disengage} action.

spell.name: Lecrul's Cake Blessing

m.text: a mixture of cornstarch, baking soda, and flour, as well as an amethyst gemstone worth at least 1000 gp which the spell consumes

entries: A massive layered cake magically forms at a point you see within range. The fluffy cake is covered in a sweet glaze that makes it the perfect dessert. Its rich and flavorful filling is solid and hearty, making it extremely popular amongst creatures from all over. The floating spectral plate beneath the cake is covered in the sweet drips of cherry and boysenberry syrup lining the side of the dessert from top to bottom.

Though it would make the perfect birthday cake for your friends and family, the magical cake also provides wondrous magical effects to those who eat it. Up to six creatures can partake in the eating of the cake, which happens during the casting time of the spell. The flavorful warm cream provides a pool of 250 temporary hit points which you can spread amongst the creatures affected by the spell. Additionally, the creatures also make all Constitution saving throws with advantage and are immune to being {@condition charmed}. The dessert also comes with one additional benefit that only affects one participant of your choice from the following options:

entries.name: Cherry on Top
entries: Only one creature can eat this massive, juicy cherry sitting at the cake's top layer. This creature can take an additional action on each of its turns that can be used for the {@action Attack} (one attack only), {@action Dash}, Use an Object, or {@action Hide} action. Its movement also does not provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Rich Chocolate Filling
entries: The cake is striped with dark brown patches of luscious melted chocolate. The creature you choose can add your Charisma modifier to any saving throw it makes as its reaction.

entries.name: Baked Alaska
entries: The layered cake is modified into the shape of this famous exquisite dessert. The creature gains immunity to cold damage and is immune to being magically {@condition restrained}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition paralyzed}.

The cake can not be eaten after the spell casting ends, and these magical benefits last for 24 hours. A creature only gains the benefits of this spell as long as it still has any temporary hit points from the cake.

spell.name: Lecrul's Cream Shower

components.m: a ball of ice cream

entries: Enormous cream puffs of ice and delicious flavor rain down at three different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. A creature can only be affected by one cream puff.

The area where the cakes land becomes covered in bits of slippery frost, making the space difficult terrain. Additionally, a creature instantly takes 5 cold damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The frosted cream absorbs into the body of the creatures it affects, and each individual area will disappear either after the cream deals 20 cold damage or when 1 minute has passed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Lecrul's Messy Meringues

components.m: a meringue

entries: You choose a creature you can see within range, and it must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d4} psychic damage and suffers the spell's effects for the duration of the spell. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not get any additional effects.

A creature affected by this spell has its vision warp back and forth and sees everything in blurry shades of purple, making all Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks with disadvantage. You choose an amount of creatures and constructs within 60 feet of you equal to your spellcasting modifier. The target sees these creatures and constructs as enormous meringues that move around in a regular fashion. The creature can still hear normally though, and believes that the cakes are living entities that have been unfortunately visually devolved into a lavish dessert. It is able to distinguish between hostile cakes and friendly cakes.

Once per turn, if a creature that the target perceives as a meringue takes damage, the cake bursts open, shooting out lemony white blotches of frosting in all directions. The target takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage. The target may make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC at the end of its turn if it takes damage from the cakes, ending the spell on a success. The target may also close their eyes at the beginning of its turn to avoid the damage; however, this leaves it {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, all damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Lecrul's Sticky Chocolate

m.text: hardened elder tree sap and opal worth at least 200 gp which the spell consumes

entries: The ground in a 40-foot radius circle centered on a point you see within range becomes covered with a brown acidic muck; this area is considered difficult terrain. Every creature within the area of the spell as it is casted is subject to the draining sludge and must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

While in the area of the spell, all creatures have vulnerability to acid and fire damage due to the wound openings that the gooey muck burned into their skin. Additionally, as a bonus action every turn until the spell ends, you can automatically deal {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage to a creature within the area. You heal an amount of hit points equal to the necrotic damage you deal.

When the spell ends, the chocolate explodes, dealing additional damage to all creatures still within the area. An affected creature must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success. On a failed save, the creature also suffers one point of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the necrotic damage you deal as a bonus action increases by {@dice 1d8}.

spell.name: Limited Magical Immunity

m.text: a glass globe and gold worth at least 300 gp

entries: You bestow a glimmering golden outline around a creature's body that prevents magic from taking any effect. A willing creature you touch is immune to spells of 5th level or lower unless it chooses to be affected for the duration of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with an 8th-level spell slot, the duration increases to 1 hour. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, the spell lasts for 24 hours.

spell.name: Mass Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 150 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: For each of five creatures you choose within range, you can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.

spell.name: Maximilian's Seismic Wave

components.m: a large stone gauntlet and a fistful of gravel

entries: Parts of the ground begin floating out of the earth into the air at a point you see within range over the course of the minute you use to cast this spell. The earth forms what appears to be a large rocky fist hovering high in the air at a point you see within range. Creatures nearby are aware that a powerful spell is being cast, seeing chunks of earth lifting before their eyes. When the spell is casted, the rocky fist collapses downward, slamming into the ground underneath it with massive impact. Every creature within a 90-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 12d12} bludgeoning damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failed save, as the earth erupts violently below it. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone}. The spell deals double damage to objects and structures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 3d12} for every level above 7th.

spell.name: Mental Reverb
entries: You damage the brain by replaying the pain of the previous round of combat. A creature you see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a thin white arc of light connects your brain to that of the target's. On this turn and on each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to attempt to use this arc to automatically attack the creature's mind. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking psychic damage equal to half the damage the target took in the last round on a failed save. The spell ends if the target is ever outside the spell's range or if it has total cover from you. Dropping the creature to 0 hit points will also end this spell.

spell.name: Metagame

m.text: a 20-sided dice worth at least 1000 gp which the spell consumes

entries: An enormous circular rift appears in the air 500 feet above a point on the ground you see within range, opening a momentary pathway to an unenterable separate plane of existence. From underneath, you can see an enormous humanoid figure in a dark hooded cloak bending over on the other side of the rift. The figure speaks a few words in a booming voice that can be heard by any creature within 1 mile of the rift, before placing a hand over it and releasing a massive {@dice d20} dice through the rift, collapsing downwards to the point you chose. The enormous dice resembles the dice you used in the casting of the spell.

Any creature in the 60-foot radius, 500-foot high cylinder underneath the rift must make a Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throw, counting the amount of successes and failures in total. The enormous magical dice affects both the physical and mental, and acts as the true test of a creature's full capabilities. A creature that failed 5 or more saving throws gets brutally crushed by the dice, taking {@damage 15d20} force damage. A creature that failed 3 or 4 saving throws takes half as much damage, and a creature that failed 2 or less saving throws takes no damage.

As the dice lands, it starts to disappear in a cloud of smoke from the bottom up, but remains motionless for enough time to identify the result of the roll. The DM then rolls a {@dice d20}, symbolizing the result of the massive dice. The effect produced by each number is listed below.

1-The power of being able to cast this spell pushes your mental and physical body beyond its limits past the threshold of life and death. You instantly die, turning into magical dust that flows with the wind in the direction of the rift. You cannot be brought back to life by any spell except for true resurrection if you die in this way.

2-A deafening boom followed by a wave of intense heat bursts out from the dice as it lands. Every creature within 500 feet of the dice must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} for 1 hour. Additionally, the area within 1 mile of the dice becomes placed under the same effect as an antimagic field for 24 hours.
3-You and every creature within 150 feet of the point you chose is each instantly transported to a random location in the Astral Plane.

4-An adult red dragon appears at the point you chose, hostile to any creature that it sees nearby. It adds itself to the turn order and will begin destroying everything on sight, with breath initially recharged. The dragon will disappear after {@dice 1d6} hours.

5-A cool ripple flows throughout your body, returning your mind and body to a fundamental and balanced state. All your ability scores instantly become 10 and you end any spell you are concentrating on.
